SENT.plain: We present a case of a left subclavian artery aneurysm in a 48-year-old man with Marfan syndrome
Aneurysms of the subclavian artery are rare in patients with Marfan syndrome
Resection of the aneurysm and interposition with a synthetic graft were performed through a supra- and infraclavicular incision, without resecting the clavicle
Histological findings were compatible with Marfan syndrome
In patients with Marfan syndrome, regular follow-up is important because of the occurrence of peripheral aneurysms other than the aorta
